message.content: The generated code currently lacks a proper database or persistent storage system for storing user and file data. All data is currently stored in memory, which means it will be lost when the application is restarted. As a suggestion, consider integrating a database system such as SQLite or PostgreSQL to persistently store user and file data. This will also allow for more complex queries and better performance when dealing with large amounts of data.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently lacks proper error handling and validation. For example, in the `register` function in `user_management.py`, there is no check to see if a user with the same email already exists. This could lead to data being overwritten unintentionally. As a suggestion, consider adding checks and validation to ensure data integrity. Also, proper error messages should be returned to the client to inform them of any issues or errors that occur.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently lacks a system for managing user sessions or authentication. After a user logs in, there is no way to keep track of their session or to authenticate subsequent requests. As a suggestion, consider implementing a system for managing user sessions, such as using JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication. This would involve generating a token upon successful login and requiring that token to be included in the header of subsequent requests to authenticate the user.
